Articles.Content:
sometimes sensors attached on a spacecraft are hidden in darkness. One can overcome ths problem with a spotlight attached with is in some way a overkill.

Getting a sensor a little bit illumineted by pressing "U" would be a smart sollution.
Don't they already glow green-ish when you mouse over them? It can be a bit unnerving to search blindly, but lights wouldn't be an option at least with the thermometre... because of heating and stuff
you could just roll your spacecraft out of shadow?
Not if you're on the dark side of a planet, you can't.

I don't think it is something that needs improvements. I think it is part of the challenge, similar to electricity. You only run into problems if you neglect it during the ship design.

- you can put your sensors on action groups - that'll allow you to activate them without need to search them around the craft

- you can use a spotlight to light up the important part of the ship

- you can use parts with glowing bits such as batteries to mark their positions
